thread.title: Gary Neville slams Tyrone Mings after shocking clash with Zlatan Ibrahimovic
thread.title_full: Gary Neville slams Tyrone Mings after shocking clash with Zlatan Ibrahimovic

title: Gary Neville slams Tyrone Mings after shocking clash with Zlatan Ibrahimovic
text:
GETTY Gary Neville has slammed Tyrone Mings and Zlatan Ibrahimovic 
The Bournemouth defender and Manchester United's superstar were caught up in an ugly altercation in their Premier League clash at Old Trafford today. 
After a strong tackle, Mings jumped up and hurdled Ibrahimovic, appearing to tread on his head in doing so. 
The Swede then returned with an elbow to Mings' face seconds later. Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Tyrone Mings incidents   ZLATAN IBRAHIMOVIC and Tyrone Mings were involved in a pair of unsavoury incidents today. 1 / 10 “That is a cowardly act from Mings, absolutely terrible” Gary Neville 
Both escaped punishment from referee Kevin Friend but Andrew Surman was sent off after he hit out at Ibrahimovic in the aftermath. 
TV pundit Neville has criticised Mings for his part in the incident and insists Ibrahimovic was in the wrong too. 
He told Sky Sports : "Oh deary me. We have just seen a UFC battle. 
"Stamping on someone’s head and then elbowing them back. Both of them should be off. 
GETTY Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Tyrone Mings clash at Old Trafford 
"Ibrahimovic is on the floor and that is a cowardly act from Mings, absolutely terrible. 
"The elbow from Ibrahimovic is not much better, but if somebody stamps on your head you are bound to go for them. 
"The referee has bottled it. I don't like saying that about referees but he has." Related articles
